description: Several Chinese officials and editors sought today to dampen speculation that China's 77-year-old leader, Deng Xiaoping, had lost authority through an internal power struggle. Speculation about the future of Mr. Deng, w ho was last seen in public on Jan. 12, followed a remark about hi m made last Saturday by a Deputy Prime Minister, Wan Li.

title: THE MOLDING OF A CITY DEPUTY MAYOR
description: It was less than a year ago that Karen Nina Gerard was working for the Chase Manhattan Bank, sitting in her office 28 floors above Wall Street, supervising a staff of two and writing searching studies of the city's economy.

title: PIANIST: REBECCA LA BRECQUE
description: THREE cheers on two counts for Rebecca La Brecque, a pianist who appeared Friday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. Miss La Brecque seems resolutely prepared to swim against the tides of fashion, and she has a consistent, not to say polemical view of what new music should be.

title: NEW PERIL TO TIMES OF LONDON
description: Rupert Murdoch, the owner of The Times of London and The Sunday Times, warned today that the papers would have to eliminate 600 jobs immediately or go out of business.

title: GOVERNORS OBJECT TO DOMESTIC CUTS IN REAGAN BUDGET
description: Governors and state legislators warned today that the cuts President Reagan has proposed for federally financed domestic programs in the next fiscal year could jeopardize his plan to turn over more than 40 Federal programs to the states.

title: GENERAL SIGNAL CORP
description: B-After foreign currency translation losses of $2.4 million for the qr and $8.4 million for the yr...C-After foreign currency translation gains of $500,000 for the qr and $1.7 million for the yr

title: PHILIPPINE TROOPS SAID TO RESCUE MISSING ATHLETE
description: More than a month after his disappearance, Tommy Manotoc, the athlete who secretly married the 26-year-old daughter of President Ferdinand E. Marcos, was reported found by a military intelligence agency.

title: URBAN LEAGUE NOW CONCENTRATES ON 4 ISSUES
description: The National Urban League, responding to cuts in Federal money for itself and for its poor black constituents, is giving priority to four issues: pregnancy among black teen-agers, the plight of poor households headed by women, crime in black neighborhoods, and voting registration and education.

title: Q&A
description: Q. Suppose a nickel-iron meteoroid 20 miles across is hurtling toward the earth. At what speed would it be moving? How much would such an object weigh? Finally, what would be the topographical and meteorological consequences when it hit the earth?

title: Talking Businesswith Stuart E. Eizenstat, a Carter Aide Energy Policy: A Critic's View
description: When Stuart E. Eizenstat was serving as President Jimmy Carter's chief domesti c adviser, energy policy was one of his principal concerns. Tod ay, Mr. Eizenstat is a lawyer in Washington, and his interest in e nergy questions has carried over into his new job. In a recent interv iew, Mr. Eizenstat, who is highly critical of President Reagan's ener gy policy, outlined his views.

title: 23 KILLED IN TOKYO BAY JET CRASH
description: A Japan Ai r Lines DC-8 with 174 people aboard crashe d into Tokyo Bay today just short of a runway as it camein for a land ing in Haneda Airport. The police said 23 passengers andcrew members were killed, 147 were rescued and 4 were missing.

title: SCHOOL BOARD TREASURER SAYS SHE SIGNED 2 DISPUTED CHECKS
description: The treasurer of Community School Board 3 said yesterday that she had identified her signature as valid on two canceled checks that other members of the board have said were among several used for questionable expenditures, including limousine rentals, liquor and cash.

title: 5 Irish Nationals Are Arrested by U.S.
description: Immigration officials said today that five Irish nationals were arrested over the weekend for attempting to enter the United States from Canada to purchase weapons.

title: Comings and Goings
description: At Louisiana State, Larry Jones was named interim athletic director. He was Paul Dietzel's assistant before Dietzel was ousted last week amid a university inquiry into his financial management policies. ... Peter Bavasi, who resigned recently as president of the Toronto Blue Jays, has been appointed head of the sports division of Hill & Knowlton, a New York-based public relations concern. ... Jim McMahon, the quarterback who set 55 N.C.A.A. records and led Brigham Young to the Western Athletic Conference title, has dropped out of school, but Coach LaVell Edwards said: ''There's no doubt in my mind that he will finish. It's not unusual for a guy who's going to be highly drafted to leave and finish it after a year.''

title: Shell Canada Spending
description: Shell Canada Ltd. said today that its capital and exploration spending for 1982 would increase to $1 billion (Canadian) from $700 million in 1981.

title: Wells, Rich Produces Star-Filled Commercials
description: Wells, Rich, Greene has produced a commercial that under ordinary circumstances no advertiser could afford. It is the fifth annual Broadway-pegged, New York City-promoting spot for the State Department of Commerce, and it features the superstars - Elizabeth Taylor, Lena Horne, Lauren Bacall and Mickey Rooney, working with Miss Taylor for the first time since the movie ''National Velvet.''

title: PERMIT TO BURN HAZARDOUS FUEL GAINS A REVIEW
description: The State Department of Environmental Conservation, reversing itself, agreed today to consider a request for an extension of a temporary permit that would allow the Alpha Portland Industries Cement Company to continue burning hazardous waste as a fuel.

title: PIANO: POLLACK PLAYS BACH-BUSONI AT Y
description: THE performance of Daniel Pollack, pianist, at the 92d Street Y on Sunday afternoon seemed designed to impress hardened competition judges with its intensity rather than stir the emotions or intellect of sympathetic listeners. In spite of that, Mr. Pollack's playing was met by a rising tide of enthusiasm, suggesting that obviousness is no fault as long as one can make an audience flinch with one's left hand.

title: ASARCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MARK PRODUCTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including tax credits of $171,000 or 2 cents a shr for the qr and $336,000 or 4 cents a shr for the yr

title: DISCLOSURE POLICY IS STUDIED
description: A House committee raised questions today about the adequacy of Securities and Exchange Commission disclosure rules. Cited as a case in point was the S.E.C.'s handling of an investigation into disclosures by th e Mobil O il Corporation of the relationship of William P. Tavoulareas, Mobil 's president, to a Mobilaffiliate that employed his son.

title: PAUL V. KEYSER JR., A FORMER EXECUTIVE FOR MOBIL OIL CORP.
description: Paul V. Keyser Jr., former executive vice president, director and member of the executive committee of the Mobil Oil Corporation, died Sunday at the Memor ial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in Manhattan. Hewas 75 years old and lived in Carefree, Ariz., and Shelter Island, L.I. He was a former resident of Douglaston, Queens.

title: 'OCCASIONS' OPENS, CLOSES
description: ''Special Occasions,'' Bernard Slade's bittersweet comedy about the relationship of two people during the 10 years after their divorce, closed with its opening performance Sunday night at the Music Box. It had played 26 previews.

title: PLAN FOR FUTURE FEE PROTESTED
description: A Reagan Administration proposal to levy a users' fee on all commodity futures transactions is drawing protests from traders and officials in the commodities industry, who say it would undermine their own efforts at self-regulation.

title: CANCELING OF FOGG WING IS CRITICIZED
description: Harvard University's decision to cancel an expansion of the Fogg Art Museum has provoked threats from donors and criticism of Derek Bok, president of the university. Mr. Bok had said that the university could not afford the expense of the addition.

title: SOHIO CREATES UNIT OF 3 TOP OFFICERS
description: The Standard Oil Company (Ohio) yesterday announced the creation of a three-member office of the chairman and said it was reorganizing its businesses into five principal product groups. The changes, to begin taking place immediately, are expected to be fully in effect by March 1.

title: HOMOCIDES INVOLVING ROBBERIES INCREASING IN CITY, STUDY SHOWS
description: A Police Department study of homicides in New York City shows that a growing number of robberies end as slayings - a statistic that the chief of detectives said was ''disturbing and directly connected to the availability of guns in this city.''

title: RISKY PROCRASTINATION OVER DISTRICT LINES
description: To the Editor:

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an editing error, an arti- cle on Friday incorrectly described a cockpit conversation before the airline crash in Washington last month. In the transcript the co-pilot - in telling the pilot of an ''accumulation'' of one- quarter to one-half inch of precipita- tion on the wing of the plane - did not refer specifically to either ice or snow.

title: FIRST COMMERCIAL BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Levington Buys Sun's Ship Unit
description: The Sun Company said it had completed the sale of its shipbuilding division to Levingston Industries of Orange, Tex., in a transaction that was completed after acceptance by the boilermakers' union of a new contract.

title: A PROMISE BROKEN BY BASEBALL CLUBS
description: To the Editor:

title: KAISER STEEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net income including income from discontinued international shipping operations of $97,000 for the qr and $8,767,000 for the yr and gains on the disposal of discontinued operations of $2,788,000 for the qr and $24,782,000 for the yr

title: U.S. Hoping Kuhn Will Aid 'Fix' Case
description: Justice Department prosecutors are hoping that Rick Kuhn, the former basketball player facing a 10-year prison term, will now cooperate with them in their continuing investigation of the Boston College point-shaving conspiracy, sources familiar with the case indicated yesterday.

title: 17.60 DROP PUTS DOW AT 833.43
description: Stock prices tumbled yesterday in response to President Reagan's projected record budget deficit for 1983. Rising interest rates and fears that the Federal Reserve might tighten its already stringent monetary policy also pushed down prices.

title: NINE MILE 2 PLANT ADVISERS' FEES CITED
description: The utilities that are building the Nine Mile Two nuclear plant paid 13 consultants $336,168 for testimony at a hearing called to examine rising costs at the plant, the Public Service Commission said today.

title: STAGE: 'ALEC WILDER,' A SONG COLLAGE
description: THE neglect of Alec Wilder as a popular composer is partly redeemed by ''Alec Wilder: Clues to a Life,'' a celebratory collage of his songs at the Vineyard Theater, at 309 East 26th Street. When the evening's four vibrant singers -D'Jamin Bartlett, Christine Andreas, Keith David and Craig Lucas - are allowed to sing Wilder straight, one can hear the purity of his melodic line and the intricacy of his lyrics (sometimes in collaboration with others). It is easily understandable why Mr. Wilder's most ardent admirers and interpreters include such stylists as Frank Sinatra and Mabel Mercer.

title: News Summary; TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 9, 1982
description: International Britain cut prices of its North Sea oil by $1.50 a barrel, to $35. The reduction, reflecting the global surplus of oil, was the most substantial p rice cut since the OPEC producers unified the cartel's price structu re last October. Oil is now available on the sport market at pri ces considerably below the OPEC base. (Page A1, Column 2.) A political solution in El Salvador is sought by the Reagan Administration, according to Thomas O. Enders, an Assistant Secretary of State. He reaffirmed before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee that the Administration was not seeking a military solution in stepping up aid for the Salvadoran junta. (A1:1.)

title: MACMILLAN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $67,000 for the qr and $4,073,000 for the yr...C-Including income of $492,000 from discontinued operations...D-Net loss after loss from discontinued operations of $1,086,000 and negative effect on prior yrs of an accounting change of $19,157,000

title: SINDONA LOSES OVER $547,000 FOR HAVING JUMPED BAIL '79
description: A Federal judge signed an order yesterday requiring Michele Sindona, the Italian financier, to forfeit more than $547,000 for having jumped bail in 1979 before his trial for bank fraud in Manhattan.

title: Ayala's Managers Say H e Rates Shot at Title
description: Lou Duva and Shelly Finkel, managers of Tony Ayala, have filed complaints with Rodrigo Sanchez, president of the World Boxing Association, concerning a proposed junior middleweight title defense by Davey Moore against Charlie Weir of South Africa.

title: Fatal Queens Fire Ascribed to Arson
description: Investigators determined yesterday that arson was the cause of a fire that killed a firefighter and one of his children in their Queens home.

title: MUSIC: ORCHESTRE DE PARIS, BARENBOIM
description: especially since he just finished playing all the piano concertos with Zubin Mehta and the New York Philharmonic. His symphony cycle began last night in Carnegie Hall with Nos. 2 and 3, and continue s every few days to Feb.19.

title: FOR CHOCOLATE LOVERS, A LOST WEEKEND AT A RESORT
description: Was the 27-foot-long table the glory of the Chocolate Binge, as some participants claimed? Or was it, as others maintained, just a cruel gauntlet designed to drive mortals mad with the sweet smell of excess?

title: ROCKIES REQUEST N.H.L. APPROVAL FOR MOVE TO NEW JERSEY
description: The Colorado Rockies, as unhappy as ever with their Denver home, made a formal request to the National Hockey League today to transfer their money-losing franchise to Byrne Meadowlands Arena in East Rutherford, N.J.

title: AFTER A STRIKE, PARIS GETS TO SEE 63 POLLOCKS
description: PARIS THANKS to the remodeling work on the Museum of Modern Art in New York, the memory of past favors and the settlement of a cleaners' strike at the Beaubourg Center, Paris is now seeing one of the most important Jackson Pollock exhibitions ever shown.

title: CARLUCCI CALLS MILITARY BUDGET MORE 'HONEST'
description: The Pentagon's second-ranking official told the Senate Armed Services Committee today that a substantial portion of the proposed increase in military spending represented a more ''honest'' estimate of the final cost of weapons and accelerated purchases than was provided previously by the Defense Department.

title: 'ONSLAUGHT' AND PARANOIA
description: The Reagan Administration's policy of closer relations with South Africa may be nudging that country nearer to permitting independence for Namibia. But cozying up to the Afrikaners with ''quiet diplomacy'' has done nothing to improve their racist, repressive regime.

title: Morocco Rejects Plea To Talk With Rebels
description: Morocco rejected a recommendation tonight by African leaders participating in a special meeting here that it negotiate directly with the Polisario Front about the future of Western Sahara.

title: LIFE ON BOARD
description: For Walter Mahoney to live a normal life - wife, children, home in the suburbs and a job in the city - he must spend an hour each morning and an hour each evening on what a fellow commuter calls a ''painful machine'': the Long Island Rail Road.

title: INTERNATIONAL FLAVORS & FRAGRANCES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The 1981 earnings reflect the adoption of the revised U.S. accounting rule for foreign currency translation; the effect of the adoption in 1981 was to increase earnings per shr by 44 cents while earnings for 1980 are based on the old rule

title: Quick Action Predicted On Mi cronesia's Status
description: The Reagan Administration said today that it hoped to work out ''in a relatively short period of time'' a political status of free association with Micronesia, one of the three major divisions of the Pacific islands, which are now under a United States-administered trusteeship.

title: DONATIONS AND LOSSES: SOME RULES LIBERALIZED
description: Taxpayers who contributed to their alma maters last year, saw their basement playrooms destroyed by a flood or attended school to further their careers may be able to pare their taxes by itemizing deductions. Last year, the new tax law also granted a retroactive break to parents who adopted hard-to-place children in 1981, permitting them to deduct some of their adoption-related expenses for the first time, and new court decisions liberalized the rules for theft and casualty losses.

title: WHO'S TRYING TO CORNER TIN?
description: Since last July, a shadowy group of speculators has spent as much as half a billion dollars buying up huge quantities of tin. Their evident attempt to corner the market has since raised the price of this normally plentiful metal more than 25 percent - to as much as $7.60 a pound in London yesterday -while the prices of other commodities have sagged under world recession.

title: REAGAN SEEKS RISE IN NATIONAL PARK FEES
description: The Reagan Administration, which has just asked for a cut of nearly $50 million in the budget for the National Park Service, is proposing to raise the fees the Government charges users of the parks.

title: Chess: Tense and Exciting Gambit That Pays Off in a Victory
description: The term ''gambit'' was derived from the Italian ''gambetto,'' to trip up one's legs as in a wrestling match, a meaning that carries over well for a sacrifice to throw the opponent off.

title: LOCTITE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After foreign currency translation losses of $449,000 for the latest second qr and $153,000 for the yr-ago second qr

title: Nurses in Ashtabula End a 570-Day Strike
description: Nurses at Ashtabula General Hospital ended a 570-day strike tonight with a vote to approve a contract proposal that would restore them to the jobs they held before the strike.

title: GENESCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: B-Includes tax credits of of $998,000 for the qr and $3.6 million for the 6 mos...C-Includes tax credits of $2.6 million for the qr and $4.2 million for the 6 mos from discontinued operations

title: SAUDIS SUGGEST DIFFERENCES MAR WEINBERGER TALKS
description: Secretary of Defense Caspar W. Weinberger met with Saudi Arabian leaders again tonight, and Saudi officials suggested that the discussions had been troubled by fundamental differences.

title: Steel Output Drops
description: Steel production fell to 1.74 million tons in the week ended last Saturday, a drop of 2.6 percent from 1.79 million tons in the previous week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. Estimated figures for the year to date showed production at 9.12 million tons, a decrease of 21 percent from the 12.56 million tons in the comparable period in the previous year. Production so far this year used 58.6 percent of capacity, compared with 80.1 percent a year earlier.

title: WHY INTEREST RATES ARE SO HIGH
description: With long-term interest rates at record levels, many business and political leaders are predicting that the President will have to bail out of his economic program before it fully begins to take hold. Many critics contend that the projected Federal budget deficits will push rates still higher, depressing financial markets and the economy. A discussion of interest rates, and why they are so high, follows.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Beverly Hills Savings and Loan said it had agreed with Torrey Enterprises Inc. to form a joint venture to develop a $125 million resort hotel and marina in San Diego.

title: 2 Killed and 2 Injured At Prison in Tennessee
description: A white inmate at Brushy Mountain State Prison shot two black prisoners to death and wounded two others tonight while forcing four guards held hostage to watch, the authorities said.

title: FOSTER, METS SET ON LOAN
description: The Mets and George Foster have reached agreement on his request for a $1 million interest-free loan, General Manager Frank Cashen said yesterday.

title: STATE'S REDISTRICTING BATTLE HEADED FOR COURT DECISION
description: The Senate's Republicans disclosed today their own plan t o reapportion New York's legislative an d Congressional districts. Their action made it much more lik ely that the courts and not the Legislature would end up drawing the state's new political lines.

title: STUDY BY BONN FORESEES TROUBLE FOR THE MILITARY
description: The West German armed forces, generally regarded as the strongest component in Western defense outside the United States, have entered a period of difficulty and possible decline, according to an official study prepared for Defense Minister Hans Apel.

title: Lopes Traded to A's
description: Steve Garvey, Davey Lopes, Bill Russell and Ron Cey of the Los Angeles Dodgers had played together for nine years, the longest span of any major league infield. Yesterday the combination was broken up when Lopes, the 35-year-old second baseman, was traded to the Oakland A's for a minor league infielder, Lance Huds on. Lopes, who was on the National League All-Star team the last four years, was plagued byinjuries and hit only .206 last season.

title: Ketchum and Its Units Are Given New Names
description: KM&G International, founded in Pittsburgh in 1923 as Ketchum, Mac-Leod & Grove and now a worldwide organization with expected 1982 billings of $400 million, has not only changed its corporate name to Ketchum Communications, but also the names of all of its advertising and public relations offices.

title: Florida Bank Merger Fought
description: Florida's largest bank-holding company, the Southeast Banking Corporation, asked a Federal court to block a proposed merger between Florida National Banks and the owners of New York's Chemical Bank.

title: U.S. PANEL URGES FURTHER RELAXING OF RESTRICTIONS ON GENE-SPLICING
description: However, the panel retreated from a proposal it adopted last fall that would have changed the guidelines to a wholly voluntary code of good laboratory practice.

title: LIFEMARK CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including an extraordinary credit of $1,838,000... C-Including a gain from discontinued operations of $2,159,000 and an extraordinary credit of $1,838,000; the company said that the extraordinary credit reflects a gain on the sale of common stock held as an investment in Dec 1980; the discontinued operations relate to the company's natural gas properties which were sold for $3.9 million effective Jan 1, 19

title: 60 Post Office Posts Attract 9,000 People
description: Almost 9,000 people converged on Kansas City's main post office today to apply for 60 letter-sorting jobs with the United States Postal Service.

title: F.C.C. REBUFFS CONGRESS ON TV LOTTERY PLAN
description: The Federal Communications Commission, in a surprise move that could have a significant impact on the allocation of thousands of new low-power television stations, rejected today a directive from Congress urging it to use a lottery to distribute broadcasting licenses.

title: BANK'S BID TO SAVE LAKER AIR FAILS
description: A last-ditch attempt to rescue Laker Airways from liquidation collapsed tonight when the bank trying to assemble a refinancing package conceded that time had run out.

title: AVEMCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
2 Banks Raise Prime to 16 1/2%
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank and Marine Midland Banks yesterday raised their prime lending r ate a quarter of a percentage point, to 16 1/2 percent, afte r holding out for a week with a smaller increase than the rest of t he industry.

title: BY 1990 MODERN QUARTZ WILL HAVE NEARLY SILENCED THE
description: TICK By JAMES P. STERBA

title: Oregon St. 57, California 50
description: Lester Conner scored 20 points for Oregon State, which m oved into a first-place tie wit h Washington in the Pacific 10.

title: CELANESE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DUQUESNE LIGHT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DEMOCRATS SPLIT ON BUDGET POLICY
description: The Democratic counterattack against P residentReagan's proposed budget for the fiscal year 1983 has been swift and sharp. But Democratic leaders concede private ly that it will be difficult to unite in Congress on a strategy for beating the President and improving their party's prospec ts in the November elections.

title: CANADA TRUSTCO MORTGAGE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Gross income figures represent investment income; the company is listed on the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges

title: ECONOMICS LABORATORY INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Northeast-Midwest Coalition Calls Budget Unfair to Region
description: The bipartisan Northeast-Midwest Congressional coalition today published an analysis of the proposed budget, contending that it demanded greater sacrifices from their regions than from other areas.

title: Ford-Subaru Wi ndshield Pact
description: The Ford Motor Company said that its glass division had contracted with Japan's Fuji Heavy Industries Ltd. to supply at least 25,000 windshields for Subaru vehicles exported to the United States.

title: A 'DEAD LANGUAGE' IS GIVEN A LIVELY DEFENSE
description: Latin may be a dead la nguage, but for 95 students at S axe Junior High School here it has provided both the medium and th e message for some lively correspondence with some of the world's m overs and shakers.

title: THE CONFLICTS IN GUATEMALA-PRESENT AND PAST
description: To the Editor:

title: MAURICE ROBINSON, PUBLISHER, IS DEAD
description: Maurice R. Robinson, the founder and chairman of Scholastic Magazines Inc. and a pioneer in the publishing of magazines and books solely for high school students, died Sunday at his home in Pelham, N.Y. He was 86 years old.

title: Holder Files Merger Suit
description: Gerson H. Werner, a New York stockholder of the Marathon Oil Company, filed a class-action suit yesterday against the United States Steel Corporation and Marathon on charges that they negotiated a merger between themselves at an overall price of $106 a share and then failed to pay at least that amount in the second phase of a twostep merger.

title: REMINGTON'S SUIT CHALLENGES PHILIPS ON ELECTRIC SHAVERS
description: Victor Kiam 2d, the chief executive officer of Remington Products Inc., has gone to court to challenge his largest competitor in the men's electric shaver market, the North American Philips Corporation.

title: AIRLINE DEREGULATION LOSERS
description: Anne Thi@beault is not one of the millions of Americans who benefited from Federal deregulation of the airline industry. Instead, Mrs. Thibeault said, she is one of deregulation's victims - and deserves restitution.

title: ACID RAIN DEBATE TELLS AS MUCH ABOUT WASHINGTON AS SCIENCE
description: WASHINGTON THE current debate in the nation's capital over acid rain offers a classic demonstration of how scien ce can be i ndentured as a handmaiden of policy. Less than two years ago , in the Carter Administration, the Environmental Protection Agency determined that the scientific evidence of the destruction be ing caused by acid rain was so overwhelming that it called for quick and far-reaching remedial action.

title: South Africa Trade Gap
description: South Africa had a trade deficit of $353 million last year, in contrast to its record surplus of $7.4 billion in 1980, the Government reported today.

title: Governor Kean's Cabinet
description: If his Cabinet selections are any indication, New Jersey's Governor Thomas Kean is off to a promising beginning. With one exception, his appointees reflect a high standard; most are intelligent, able and representative of a diverse population.

title: INSURANCE EXECUTIVE CHOSEN TO HEAD S.B.A.
description: President Reagan has chosen a California civil engineer and insurance executive to head the Small Business Administration. James C. Sanders, the nominee, is 55 years old.

title: CADO SYSTEMS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
COLUMBUS MILLS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
HEARING TOLD OF DIFFERENCES ON HOW STOUFFER FIRE BEGAN
description: William B. Fleming, an assistant Westchester District Attorney, testified today that two experts thought that the fatal fire at Stouffer's Inn in 1980 was accidental. But he said that a third investigator agreed with the prosecutor, whose final conclusion was arson.

title: LITTLE, ARTHUR D, INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Two Guys Chain Ended
description: Vornado Inc., the Garfield, N.J., company that operates the Two Guys discount store chain, said it had closed its last 12 stores as part of a plan to become a real estate development company.

title: Lee B. Wood Is Dead; Ex-Newspaper Editor
description: Lee B. Wood, retired editor of The New York World-Telegram and The Sun, died Sunday at St. John's West Shore Hospital in West Lake, Ohio. He was 88 years old and had lived in West Lake, a suburb of Cleveland, for several years.

title: CANADA CEMENT LAFARGE LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including a special gain of $1.3 million...C-After a special loss of $2.8 million; yr-ago results have been restated

title: RAYMARK OFFICERS SET FOR MERGED OPERATION
description: As president and chief executive officer of Raybestos-Manhattan Inc., Frederick J. Ross, 55 years old, had led his company's resistance to efforts by Hi-Shear Industries to acquire a sizable stake in the much-larger Raybestos. But when the two companies agreed to a merger last week, Mr. Ross emerged as president and chief executive of the new company, to be called the Raymark Corporation.

title: Convictions Overturned For Tennessee Officials
description: A Federal court today overturned the convictions of two associates of former Gov. Ray Blanton of Tennessee in a clemency-bribery case. The United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit ruled that the Governor's office cannot be considered an ''enterprise'' within the terms of the Federal Racketeer Influenced Corrupt Organizations Act.

title: Continental Air Is Denied Funds
description: Continental Air Lines Inc. said it had been denied new funds under an unsecured, $125 million revolving credit agreement with lenders.

title: POLAND OUTLINES NEW ECONOMIC PROGRAM
description: The Government issued the outline of a program for economic and political changes today intended to make Poland economically independent from the West and self-sufficient in food production.

title: BAKER TRIES TO QUIET STORM RAISED BY G.O.P. ON DEFICIT
description: Howard H. Baker Jr., the Senate majority leader, sought today to calm Republican senators who have been expressing anguish and dismay about the $91.5 billion budget deficit proposed by President Reagan for the fiscal year 1983.

title: BRIEFING
description: L ATEST Washington joke: They've just discovered the Coolidge tapes. Four years of silence.

title: MARCOS SON-IN-LAW ISSUES AN APOLOGY
description: A Philippine athlete who vanished Dec. 29 after secretly marrying a daughter of President Ferdinand E. Marcos apologized on radio and television today because his family had accused the Marcos family of complicity in his disappearance.

title: MICHAEL FLAUMENHAFT
description: Michael Flaumenhaft, former chairman of the board of the C. J. Osborn Company of Linden, N.J., died Sunday in Norwood (Mass.) Hospital.

title: Detectives Seeking A Missing Student
description: Detectives questioned residents and employees of a Riverside Drive cooperative apartment building and others in an effort to locate a missing medical student who is married to a member of a prominent real-estate family.

title: Economic Scene; Reagan Reality - And Reality
description: DESPITE the efforts of President Reagan and his economic advisers to treat the projected deficits in the Federal budget as relatively small and harmless, Wall Street finds them staggering. The financial markets are reeling from the Administration's estimates of deficits of $98.6 billion in the fiscal year 1982, $91.5 billion in 1983, $82.9 billion in 1984 and $71.9 billion in 1985, for a four-year total of $355 billion.

title: SANMARK-STARDUST INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes tax credits of $402,000 for the quarter and $800,000 for the 6 months and $169,815 gain for the quarter from the sale of a plant; C-Net loss

title: BARCO OF CALIFORNIA (CO) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The Nassau Felony Compounded
description: Never underestimate the resourcefulness of Joseph Margiotta, the gall of his Nassau Republican machine or the guile of New York election officials. All have combined to keep him in the county chairmanship that he should have forfeited when convicted of fraud and extortion last month.

title: Panel Hears Phone Fears
description: Concerns about the financial strength of the American Telephone & Telegraph Company's 22 local phone subsidiaries, once they become independent, were expressed today at a House subcommittee hearing on telecommunications.

title: U.S. AND SAUDIS TO FORM PANEL ON MILITARY PROJECTS
description: After negotiating until nearly dawn today, Secretary of Defense Caspar W. Weinberger announced today that the United States and Saudi Arabia had agreed to establish a ''joint committee for military projects.''

title: KNOWING MUTAGENS FOUND IN FRIED FOOD
description: fried at temperatures as high as those used in grilling, baking or broiling.

title: SENATORIAL FARE ON AND OFF THE FLOOR
description: Daniel Webster proclaimed the glories of fish chowder. Huey Long waxed eloquent over the virtues of pot liquor. Barry Goldwater and John Tower caused Senate mouths and eyes to water in their Arizona vs. Texas chili debate of 1974.

title: Phillips Oil Loan
description: The Phillips Petroleum Company will sign a $400 million loan agreement next week with a consortium of 32 banks led by National Westminster Bank Ltd. and Citibank N.A., a Phillips spokesman said here today. The previously announced loan will be used to finance British operations, including work on the North Sea Maureen Field.

title: WYOMING BANCORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings adjusted for a 10 percent stock divd payable Feb 26

title: MALLINCKRODT INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
News Analysis
description: The leadership of the United Automobile Workers is going to unusual lengths to persuade its members that the Ford Motor Company is in financial trouble and that any wage or benefit concession granted by the union would not be a gift but a hard-fought trade-off in return for gains in job security.

title: SMITH INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: 1981 results include the adoption of LIFO accounting for domestic inventories

HOUSE APPROVES FUNDS ON FUEL AID AND JOBLESS
description: Responding to the continuing slump in the economy and faulty projections by the Reagan Administration, the House approved emergency funds today to help unemployed workers, farmers in need of loans and poor families who cannot afford their fuel bills.

title: THE RIGHT SPOONS
description: SPOONS are almost as important - and as common - in the kitchen as heat is. So it's wise to choose spoons well and to know how and when to use them.

title: TWIN CITY BARGE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Latest yr net income includes $1,168,000 tax credit and previous yr includes $115,000 tax credit

title: FRATERNITY BARRED FOR SPONSORING RACIST PARTY
description: The University of Cincinnati has suspended a fraternity that celebrated the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s birthday with a racially demeaning party, but blacks on campus and in the city say that is not enough.

title: MANVILLE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Orion Group Gets Filmways
description: A controlling interest in Filmways Inc. was purchased yesterday by an investor group led by Orion Pictures. Troubled Filmways, whose film division lost over $20 million in the six months ended last Aug.3l, had been seeking a buyer since last October when it hired the investment banking firms of Wertheim and Company and Bear, Stearns and Company to help in the search. Several bids, including an offer from Macro Communications and the Reliance Group, have fallen through in recent months.

title: FRANK'S NURSERY SALES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31

description: * Maximum rate payable by savings institutions.Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: CORRUPT OFFICIALS DRAW PEKING'S IRE
description: The Peking leadership is preparing a major crackdown on official corruption within the Government and the Communist Party, according to Chinese and Western diplomatic sources here.

title: CUSTOM ENERGY SERVICES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec
Tempest in Tennis
description: Phillippe Chatrier, a Frenchman who is the president of the International Tennis Federation, apologized for comments about black players, contending that his remarks were misinterpreted. Responding to quotes suggesting that he felt blacks might be naturally unsuited to play tennis well, Chatrier said, ''It's ridiculous to say that.

title: INDICTMENTS EXPECTED IN NUNS' DEATHS
description: A brother of one of the Roman Catholic nuns killed in El Salvador 14 months ago said last night that the State Department had told him that six members of the Salvadoran National G uard would be indicted today in the killings.

title: XOIL ENERGY RESOURCES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
BEVERLY ENTERPRISES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
John Fuller Replies
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION: Robert Palmer's article (''Pop Life'') on Jan. 6 accuses me of ''outright falsification'' concerning crowd disturbances and destructive action on the part of certain rock groups in my book ''Are the Kids All Right.'' He states there is not a ''shred of documentation,'' yet fails to acknowledge over 60 documented disturbances in my book, all of which are supported by a six-page bibliography and over 100 hours of taped interviews.

title: LA POINTE INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Bear, Stear ns & Company has named Donald C. Patterson, Christopher L. Melvin and Susanne F. James as senior vice presidents of the public utilit y unit of the company's public finance department. * Bucyrus-Erie Company, South Milwaukee, Wis., has appointed Henry C. Miller chief executive officer of its subsidiary companies, the Western Gear Corporation and the Western Gear Machinery Company.

title: 'DAS BOOT,' THE FORTUNES OF A U-BOAT
description: ''DAS BOOT'' isn't just a German film about World War II; it's a German naval adventure epic that has already been a hit in West Germany. Its attitude toward war is distinctly critical, which must account for some share of the film's popularity. But so do the quiet compassion and precise detail with which its story has been told.

title: UDS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
AMF INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31

title: SOUTHWEST IS CASHING IN ON THE PESOS FROM WEALTHY VISITORS FROM MEXICO
description: Retailers, merchants and real estate developers here and across the Southwest are cashing in this winter on the growing number of wealthy Mexicans coming north of the border to spend and invest their pesos on anything from apartment condominums and vacations to new automobiles and clothing.

title: L.I. Man Guilty Of Killing Boy, 13
description: A Long Island man was convicted of kidnapping a 13-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl, then murdering the boy and sexually assaulting the girl.

title: U.S. AIDE CALLS SOVIET RESPONSIBLE FOR THE 'ECLIPSE OF ARMS CONTRL'
description: Eugene V. Rostow, head of the United States Arms Control and Disarmament Agency, said today that Soviet expanionist policy was responsible for the ''eclipse of arms control.''

title: STAGE: 'FEROCIOUS KISSES,' A SHOW-BIZ THRILLER-FARCE
description: THERE is a funny payoff in ''Ferocious Kisses,'' the new comedy at the Manhattan Punch Line, although goodness knows it is a long time coming, and until it does most of the fun comes from watching Harry Goz. Come to think of it, even when the payoff does come, we are still watching Mr. Goz, who is awfully amusing as your everyday bigshot talent agent - brutish, conniving and insincere. ''Ferocious Kisses,'' by Gil Schwartz, is about show business.

title: CARLISLE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
'81 Magazine Revenues Passed $3 Billion Mark
description: According to the Magazine Publishers Association, magazines belonging to the Publishers Information Bureau had an estimated $3.2 billion in revenues last year.

title: Five Minibuses Added For Newark's Airlink
description: Five new 15-passenger, air-conditioned, diesel-powere d minibuses have been added to the Airlink service between Newar k International Airport and downtown Newark.

title: Sears to Open 45 Office Centers
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company said its merchandise group will open 45 additional business systems centers this year.

title: Times Mirror Profit Climbs
description: The Times Mirror Company, which publishes The Los Angeles Times, The Denver Post, The Hartford Courant and other newspapers, reported today that net income for the fourth quarte r of 1981 rose 17.9 percent, to $50 million, or $1.46 a share, from $ 42.4 million, or $1.24 a share, in the fourth quarter of1980.

title: PAKISTANIS EXPEL A MALARIA EXPERT
description: Pakistani authorities e xpelled the American head of a malaria research center in Lahore l ast week as a Soviet magazine said the laboratory was breeding dis ease-bearing mosquitoes for use in Afghanistan and Cuba, using unsusp ecting Pakistanis as guinea pigs.

title: The Glass House Blahs
description: The symptoms are unmistakable: after a year at the United Nations, the American delegate feels depressed and frustrated, sometimes see enemies everywhere and doubts the fidelity of friends. The afflicted have included Adlai Stevenson and Daniel Patrick Moynihan. Now Jeane Kirkpatrick complains. Call it ''the U.N. blahs''; like black lung and coal mining, the disease goes with the job.

title: Smaller Cuts For S.E.C.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission is scheduled to lose 125 staff positions in President Reagan's proposed budget for th e fiscal year 1983, much less than the possible cuts thecommission ha d been facing last fall.

title: A Deficiency Budget Approved in Albany
description: After debate on $34 million in ''pork barrel'' items, the Assembly passed a $185.6 million deficiency budget today that raises state spending for the current fiscal year to about $16.8 billion.

description: B-After a loss from discontinued operations of $235,000 and again from purchaseof debentures of $936,000, or 29 cents a share; C-After a loss from discontinued operations of $664,000 a loss on disposal f discontinued operations of $786,000 and a gain of $1,287,000, or 43 cents a share, from insurance recovery; D-After a loss from discontinued operations of $186,000 and a gain of $1,102,000, or 34 cents a share, from purchase of debentures

One Day at a Time
description: That day in September 1975 in Sacramento, Calif., when he disarmed a woman trying to shoot Gerald R. Ford, changed his entire life, according to Larry M. Buendorf.

E.E.C. Backs Its Subsidies
description: Common Market officials said today that subsidies to their steelmakers were permitted under international trade rules and that, if the producers were found in violation of fair trade practices in the United States, the community would appeal to a higher international authority.

title: INTEREST RATES LITTLE CHANGED
description: Interest rates were little changed yesterday as dealers and investors curbed their activity while waiting for more information about monetary policy and money-supply growth.

title: ISRAEL IS SAID TO WEIGH AN INVASION OF LEBANON IF P.L.O. RAIDS GO ON
description: Israel has reportedly been considering plans for a large-scale invasion of southern Lebanon to clear out the Palestinian military reinforcements that have been brought into the region since the cease-fire there last July.

SARGENT-WELCH SCIENTIFIC CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After $155,000 loss from discontinued operations for the quarter and $980,000gain from discontinued operations for the year; C-Includes $609,000 gain from discontinued operations and $2,792,000 gain from disposal of discontinued operations

title: A RECORD YEAR FOR A CADILLAC DEALER
description: No one worries about sticker shock in George Principe's wood-paneled Cadillac showroom. While other dealers were fretting last year about the recession and slumping sales and buyers' preference for foreign cars, he and his six salesmen sold 996 new Cadillacs - more than ever before.

title: BAIRD CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
BEN NICHOLSON, BRITISH ABSTRACT ARTIST, DIES AT 87
description: Ben Nicholson, the Abstract painter, died Saturday at the age of 87. Represented in permanent collections around the world, Mr. Nicholson began as a painter of realistic still lifes and landscapes. He gradually developed an abstract, geometric style, strongly influenced by Cubism and the Dutch ''De Stijl'' group. Among his finest works were his white reliefs of the 1930's, in which geometric shapes were set out from or sunk into carved wooden panels.

title: BUTLER INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including an extraordinary gain of $931,000 from the writeoff of transportation operating rights; C-After a charge of $1.9 million related to transportation operating rights

title: BOEING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Atari Swells Warner Profit
description: Warner Communications Inc. reported yesterday that its fourth quarter earnings rose 70 percent, to $75.8 million, or $1.17 a share, from $44.6 million, or 76 cents, in the similar 1980 period. There were more shares outstanding in the latest quarter than in the 1980 period.

title: CHEMICAL BUYS STOCK OPTION
description: The Chemical New York Corporation paid $2 million and granted a $4 million interest-free loan to a group of Venezuelan investors yesterday for an option to purchase nearly 10 percent of the stock of Florida National Banks of Florida Inc.

description: ''Hungry i Reunion'' was shown in last year's ''Movies for Cynics'' series at the Paramount Theater. Following are excerpts from a review by Vincent Canby in The New York Times on Sept. 18, 1981. The film is playing at the Public Theater, 425 Lafayette Street.

Gold Margins Reduced
description: The Commodity Exchange said yesterday that it was reducing margin requirements on gold contracts by $200 to $250, effective immediately. It said margins on speculative gold positions were being reduced by $250 per contract, to $1,250, with margins on hedge positions lowered $200, to $800. An exchange spokesman said the reduction in gold margin requirements reflected ''reduced volatility in the gold f utures market.''

title: Tarrytown G.M.'s 2-Week Shutdown
description: The General Motors Corporation has ordered a two-week shutdown of its North Tarrytown plant beginning next Monday and 4,600 employees will be laid off.

description: No matter how the Legislature redraws the state's po litical boundaries, the new district lines will radically alter theba lance of power in the Legislature between New York City and the re st of the state.

description: B-Reflects for two months the operation of Benjamin Franklin Savings Association

title: PANEL ON WOMEN AWAITS AN AGENDA
description: People often complain that Government programs and procedures acquire a life of their own, lingering long after a problem has been solved or, perhaps, proved incapable of being solved. But there is another side of the story.

title: WESTINGHOUSE CANADA LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Kerr-McGee Deal
description: The Kerr-McGee Corporation said it had completed arrangements for the Prudential Insurance Company of America to invest up to $140 million in a three-year exploration program. Prudential will participate as a limited partner in the acquisition and exploration of oil and gas leases in the Gulf of Mexico, Kerr-McGee said. The program covers some leases now held and leases that will be acquired by Kerr-McGee over the three years, it said.

title: LEVESQUE WINS A PARTY VOTEON HOW TO SEEK SOVEREIGNTY
description: Premier Rene Levesque of Quebec, who threatened to resign after a Parti Quebecois convention in December, has received an overwhelming vote of confidence from p arty members.

title: No Headline
description: Stenmark Wins Giant Slalom

title: KOCH WILL AGAIN ALLOW CHECKOFFS FOR CHARITIES
description: The Koch administration, which discontinued payroll deductions for United Way of Tri-State more than a year ago because of reservations about the way they were conducted, announced yesterday that it had devised a new plan.

title: President For Bank O f New York
description: At the Bank of New York, which has 190 branches in the state and $11.4 billion in assets, Peter Herrick, 55, has been named president and chief operating officer. He succeeds J. Carter Bacot, 49, who will continue as chairman and chief executive officer of the bank and as chairman and president of its holding corporation, the Bank of New York Company.

title: KEUFFEL & ESSER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BANGOR PUNTA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings reflect dilution; year-ago results have been restated to reflectadoption of FASB Statement No 52 regarding foreign currency translations which increased net income by $238,000, or 3 cents per diluted share

title: SAFETY-KLEEN CORP reports earnings for 16 wks to Jan 2
description: Results for the latest periods are for 16 weeks and 52 weeks and results for the year-ago periods are for 17 weeks and 53 weeks

title: NANCY HELEN PEARSON
description: Nancy Helen Pearson, a teacher and translator, died Saturday in her home, the Turkey Cottage, in Mendham, N.J., of complications resulting from emphysema and a heart ailment.

title: U.S. CASTS DOUBT ON U.N. RIGHTS ACCORD
description: The Reagan Administration's senior human rights official said today that he opposed United States ratification of a United Nations covenant setting international standards in economic and social rights.

title: Nicholas T. Fernicola, Served As New Jersey State Senator
description: Nicholas T. Fernicola, who served as a State Senator from Essex County from 1965 to 1967, died Sunday at St. Mary's Hospital here.

title: AMERICAN DIAGNOSTICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec
DOWN-HOME AMERICAN FOOD IS THE MOTIF
description: -------------------------------------------------------------------- Lorna J. Sass's historical cookbook, ''Christmas Feasts,'' has recently been co-published by Irena Chalmers Cookbooks and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. By LORNA J. SASS

title: STANDARD REGISTER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: 1980 results restated to reflect an accounting change

title: U.S. TAKES ISSUE WITH COSTA-GAVRAS FILM ON CHILE
description: In a highly unusual move, the State Department released today a three-page statement taking issue with a movie. The film is Costa-Gavras's ''Missing,'' based on the story of Charles Horman, a young American who was killed during a right-wing coup in Chile in 1973. The State Department is objecting to the impression left by the film that the United States had contrived in the death, or had at least covered up events surrounding the case.

title: NEW MUSIC: FOR VIOLIN AND PIANO
description: SPECTRUM is a two-year-old ''composers' cooperative.'' It presents its concerts at Christ and St. Stephen's Church, at 120 West 69th Street, near Lincoln Center, and it has become a popular spot for new-music groups.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL CHICAGO (AL) - Signed Wayne Nord- hagen, outfielder, to one-year contract. LOS ANGELES (NL) - Rehired Del Crandall as manager of Albuquerque farm team in Pacific Coast League. KANSAS CITY (AL) - Invited Dave Frost, pitcher, and nine other nonroster players to spring training: Don Slaught and Duane Dewey, catchers; Dave Leep- er, outfielder, and Don Hood, Keith Creel, Derek Beotelho, Dan Fischer, Mike Mor- ley and Vince Yukas, pitchers. MONTREAL (NL) - Signed Bill Gul- lickson, pitcher, an

title: CASINO COMMISSION ATTACKED BY JERSEY'S ATTORNEY GENERAL
description: Governor Kean's newly appointed Attorney General, Irwin I. Kimmelman, charged today that the Casino Control Commission ''has abdicated its responsibility and cast its lot with the casinos'' in permitting casinos to decide whom to bar as professional blackjack players.

title: SALVADOR'S DILUTED LAND REFORM
description: To the Editor:

title: UPPER PENINSULA POWER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Ex-Guard Pleads Guilty I n Coast Brink's Robbery
description: A 26-year-old former Brink's guard pleaded guilty this morning to driving away the armored truck he was supposedly guarding and making off with $1.8 million.

title: EL PASCO CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net loss after a loss from discontinued operations of $365,425 for the quarter and year

title: REAGAN 'FEDERALISM' IS MODEL FOR A PLAN BY GOV. THORNBURGH
description: Gov. Dick Thornburgh, borrowing an idea from President Reagan, proposed today that Pennsylvania provide $127 milli on in block grants to the state's 501 sc hool districts, which would spend the money as they saw fit in the next fiscal year.

title: CAREY URGES RAISING DRINKING AGE TO 19
description: Governor Carey, expressing concern over an increase in alcohol-related automobile fatalities among 18-year-olds, proposed today that New York's legal drinking age be raised by one year, to 19.

title: Purr-fect for the Role
description: It was an 8-month-old cat named Hamlet II that was getting the attention yesterday, but it was a middle-aged hotel manager named Andrew Anspach who was doing most of the purring.

title: 60 MINUTE GOURMET
description: WHILE fillet of beef is eminently suited to the 60-minute kitchen, I have conscientiously avoided recommending it over the years because of its cost. However, that cut of beef is frequently on sale in the local supermarket. So, because its preparation can be simplicity itself, it seemed worthwhile to include a fillet recipe this week.

title: SERVICE FRACTURINGCO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PENTAIR INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
1. Antique Valentines
description: An unusual Valentine gift could be a piece of sentimental jewelry from Tobey Landey's collection of antiques. Miss Landey has been scouting auctions and flea markets for the past decade, finding old lockets and pins with cupid and heart themes. Her silver Valentine collection, now in Bloomingdale's, includes a heart-shaped locket to hold a photograph ($135), cupid pins ($94) and a charming place card holder of hearts and cupids ($115). You'll find them in the costume jewelry department on the street floor. 2. Blooming With Silk A Valentine bouquet can last a long time, thanks to a bright idea from Marguerite Hennessey, who presides over a florist business called the Whole Blooming Works. For $40, Miss Hennessey will put together an arrangement of fresh spring flowers in a bamboo basket. Along with it, she sends a bunch of silk flowers and as the fresh ones die, the fake ones can be ''planted'' in the basket. (The arrangement shown is of silk flowers.) The Whole Blooming Works, at 111 West 28th Street, requires at least one day's notice and will deliver in Manhattan only for a fee of $1.50. Telephone is 695-3247.

title: G & K SERVICES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
Hudson Chain Layoffs Are Seen
description: The J.L. Hudson Company, the largest department store chain in the Detroit area, is planning to reduce its staff by about 500 in the next few weeks, according to reliable trade sources.

title: WHY WOMEN S HUN THE PHYSICAL SCIENCES
description: To the Editor:

title: NAVCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Bache Program On Japan Stock
description: Bache Halsey Stuart Shields Inc., the brokerage firm, announced yesterday that it was introducing a new investment service through which Americans could invest directly in Japanese stocks through local offices in the United States.

title: SCHOOL BUSING DEBATE CURBED
description: The Senate voted by a narrow margin today to end a renewed filibuster against a bill carrying the strictest limits on court-ordered busing to achieve school integration ever to be considered in Congress.

title: STATE APPROVES COMPLETION OF A-PLANT AT 9 MILE POINT
description: The State Public Service Commission agreed today to allow the completion of the Nine Mile Point 2 nuclear power plant on the shore of Lake Ontario, despite overruns that have caused an increase of more than tenfold in cost projections in eight years.

title: Kentucky Loses Star
description: Sam Bowie, the 7-foot-1-inch junior center for the University of Kentucky, who has missed the team's first 20 games this season with a hairline fracture of his left shin, said he would sit out the rest of the season to retain two years of eligibility. ... David A. Didian, an enforcement representative of the National Collegiate Athletic Association, said that the University of Wisconsin would be investigated for its recruitment of Jerry Reynolds, a New York prep basketball star who has signed a letter of intent to attend Wisconsin. According to a report in The Milwaukee Sentinel, Reynolds has contended that Hank Carter, a local banker, paid the player's living expenses in Madison while he was trying to meet entrance requirements for the school. Mr. Carter yesterday denied the newspaper's assertion that he had been treated to meals by the university's basketball coaching staff but admitted he had co-signed a $2,000 loan for Reynolds. Wisconsin is on a one-year probation for improperly recruiting Carlton Walker, a football player.

title: DENNIS, RACING DRIVER, SERIOUSLY HURT IN CRASH
description: Bill Dennis, a 46-year-old racing driver, was seriously injured today when he lost control of his car during qualifying for the Sportsman event at Daytona International Speedway.

title: SONICS SUBDUE KNICKS, 114 -105
description: The SuperSonics' 114-105 victory over the Knicks before 17,035 fans at the Kingdome tonight was Seattle's seventh straight, and proved how things can go well for a streaking team.

title: Red Brigades Attack Army Depot in Italy
description: Four Red Brigades guerrillas overpowered 13 guards at an army depot near here today and made off with arms in the Brigades' first action since police raids this month after the rescue of Brig. Gen. James L. Dozier.

title: U.S INTEREST RATES: CURRENCY MOVER
description: United States interest rates have become the driving force behind exchange rates, replacing such more fundamental factors as balance-of-payments deficits and inflation, according to a variety of experts.

title: Marion S. Wyeth, Architect; Designed Buildings in Florida
description: Marion S. Wyeth, an architect who had designed many homes in Palm Beach, Fla., and institutional buildings in the area, died last Thursday at the Good Samaritan Hospital in West Palm Beach. He was 94 years old and lived in Palm Beach.

title: DANCE: RISA JAROSLOW'S 'CONSPIRACY'
description: THE choreographic weather was windy Monday night at the Bessie Schonberg Theater, where Risa Jaroslow and Dancers presented two works by Miss Jaroslow.

title: Oil Companies Bid for Leases
description: The Matagorda Island area off the Texas coast drew some big bids today at the Federal Government's first sale of sea bottom oil and natural gas leases in the Gulf of Mexico this year.

title: AMF Profit Down
description: AMF Inc., a manufacturer of industrial equipment and sporting goods, said today that its fourth-quarter profit fell 18.2 percent, to $12.1 million, or 52 cents a share, from $14.8 million, or 66 cents a share, a year before. Sales rose to $319.7 million, from $316.8 million. The full year's net income fell 28 percent to $42 million, or $1.84 a share, from 1980's $58 million, or $2.58 a share, while sales rose to $1.27 billion from $1.21 billion.

title: BIRD & SON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including $336,000 income from discontinued operations for the quarter and the year; C-after losses from discontinued operations of $1,058,000 for the quarter and $3,720,000 for the year

title: Comings and Goings
description: The Philadelphia 76ers are frequently reported to be trying to trade Darryl Dawkins, but yesterday team officials said they were making progress on signing him to a contract that would replace the one that expires after this season. ''It's something we want to get done,'' said Pat Williams, the general manager.

title: VITRAMON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
UNION ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SALVADOR'S DILUTED LAND REFORM
description: To the Editor:

title: A Mugging Reviewed
description: The way Howard Kissel tells it, it was ''a genteel mugging.'' It happened at dusk last week when Mr. Kissel, the drama critic for Women's Wear Daily, was on his way home with his hands full - ''some stuff from the office in one arm and four pounds of wheat from a healh food store in the other.''

title: AROUND THE NATION
description: Children in suburban Marlborough will not be spending their lunch money battling electronic starships and galactic invaders anymore. At least during school hours, it is now illegal.

title: Market Place; Stock Market Called Bargain
description: JOHN M. TEMPLETON, an investment fund manager, said recently that there was a 50-50 chance that the Dow Jones industrial average would reach 3,000 in five years - a startling prediction at a time of considerable market distress.

title: GENERAL SHALE PRODUCTS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
RULING DUE ON POWER PLANT COST-SHARING
description: A Federal agency is on the verge of deciding whether electricity customers will have to help pay for building power plants that will not generate electricity for almost a decade. Athough the decision, by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, would affect only wholesale customers, industry spokesmen believe thedecision may influence state public utility commissions, which set retail rates.

title: Bridge: New Berkowitz-Lilie Pair Won Success in Regionals
description: Some experts pursue the tournament trail week in, week out, and have no other occupation. The majority pursue a more orthodox occupation, but fit in bridge events whenever they can. Among the most successful partnerships in t he latter group has beenone shown on the convention card as Berkowitz -Lilie. These names were among the winners in the r ecent Tristate Regionalsin Port Chester, N.Y., but it was not the usu al partnership of David Berkowitz of Secaucus, N.J., and Harold Lilie of Woodmere, L.I. Instead, their wives -Lisa Berkowitz and Joyc e Lilie - were on the winning squad in the women's Swiss teams.

title: ABOUT NEW YORK
description: Courtroom 525 in the State Supreme Court building in Brooklyn is decorated in light wood and dominated by the words ''All Persons Are Equal Before the Law,'' carved into the long back wall.

title: SERVICEMASTER INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The Parole Commissioner's Term
description: The Justice Department has nothing personal against O.J. Keller, one of nine members of the U.S. Parole Commission. It just wants his job.

title: INSTALLMENT DEBT FALLS $173 MILLION
description: Consumer installment debt fell $173 million in December, as Americans paid off more than they borrowed for the first time since July 1980, another recession period, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: G.E. Zero-Coupon Issue
description: The General Electric Credit Corporation pl ans its second zero-coupon Eurobond issue in about two weeks, Mo rgan Stanley International said here today. The issue will have a pa r value of $600 million, and the company will get about $108 mi llion. The issue is in two parts - $200 million 12-year maturity, pr iced at 19.75 to yield 14.47 percent, and $400 million 13-year ma turity, priced at 17.25 to yield the same.

title: No Headline
description: 2 BLACK INMATES SLAIN AND 2 INJURED BY 7 WHITE PRISONERS AT TENNESSEE ; PENITENTIARY

title: NEWBERRY ENERGY reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After a loss of $470,000 from the settlement of litigation; C-Including a gain of $725,000 from the sale of real estate and a subsidiary

title: S TAGE: KANDINSKY WORK FINALLY GIVEN PREMIERE
description: The temptation to resurrect Wassily Kandinsky's pioneering multimedia, synesthetic extravanganza, ''The Yellow Sound,'' must have been well nigh irresistible. The Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum is mounting a three-part Kandinsky show, the first portion of which - ''Kandinsky in Munich, 1896-1914,'' devoted to exploring the context from which Kandinsky arose - is on display now through March 21. In addition, the music was by Thomas de Hartmann, a shadowy figure best known for his later association with G. I. Gurdjieff, the mystic.

title: DYNATECH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ROBERT T. HANDREN
description: Robert T. Handren, an architect and engineer, died Feb. 2 at his home in Phillipsburg, N.J. He was 74 years old. Mr. Handren was a partner in the Manhattan firm of Handren-Sharp Associates, which designed schools and other institutional buildings in the New York area. The firm was dissolved when he retired three years ago.

title: PUBLIC SERVICE CO OF NORTH CAROLINA reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After gain of $2,387,000 from cumulative effect of change in accounting

title: PEKINGESE WINS BEST IN SHOW
description: The smallest dog in the ring scored the biggest victory of her career last night when she was singled out at Madison Square Garden as the supreme winner of the 106th Westminster Kennel Club show.

title: 2 BLACKS SURMOUNT ODDS TO ATTAIN ELUSIVE GOALS
description: Blacks have entered law school and the practice of law in everlarger numbers in the last decade, but most of them have found two of the profession's most lofty perquisites - memberships in school law reviews and partnerships in large law firms - to be elusive.

title: Yanks Invite Murcer to Camp
description: Bobby Murcer, who does not have a job, will join the Yankees in spring training next week without a contract. Tommy John, who has a job, is not expected to join them Wednesday, even though, according to the club's front office, he has a contract.

title: TEXTRON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes gains from discontinued operations of $100,000 for the qr and $6 million for the yr...C-Net loss...D-After losses from discontinued operations of $77.6 million for the qr and $81.7 million for the yr

title: LANCASTER COLONY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Year-ago results have been restated for an acquisition on a pooling of interests basis

title: VAN SCHAACK & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
2 Held in Invasion Of Queens Home
description: Two 21-year-old Brooklyn men were arrested yesterday in the breakin of a Queens home a week ago in which a family of five was terrorized.

title: EG&G INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid in January 1981

title: No Headline
description: MISSOURI BEATS KANSAS, 42-41

title: LILLY, ELI, & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
EXCERPTS FROM SPEECH BY HAIG
description: Following are excerpts from the official text of Secretary of State Alexander M. Haig Jr.'s speech today at the conference on European security and cooperation:

title: WINE TALK
description: CONSUMERS in quest of imported wines at bargain prices have turned increasingly to Italy, the world's most prolific wine producer, a nation that is now responsible for more than 60 percent of the imported wines sold in the United States. Most of the Italian imports fall into the category of lambrusco, a lightly carbonated, lowalcohol confection that is quaffed like beer by youthful imbibers all across the country.

title: LANE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Books Of The Times
description: By Christopher Lehmann-Haupt CLARE BOOTHE LUCE. By Wilfrid Sheed. 183 pages. Illustrated. Dutton. $12.95.

title: A FORMER SYNAGOGUE GETS DESIGNATION AS A LANDMARK
description: Despite the reservations of several of its members, the Landmarks Preservation Commission yesterday designated a former synagogue on the Upper West Side as a landmark.

title: Q&A
description: Q. I have friends who contend that smoked salmon and lox are the same. I believe that they have a different taste and are produced by a different method of curing. Can you tell me?

title: Renault Buys A.M.C. Stock
description: The American Motors Corporation has sold $32.5 million in preferred stock and warrants to purchase common stock to its French partner, Renault, American Motors said.

title: Air Force to Deactivate T itan Missiles in Arizona
description: The Air Force said today that it expected to deactivate the first of 52 aging Titan 2 intercontinental nuclear missiles at the Davis-Monthan Air Force Base in Arizona late this year.

title: REAGAN AIDS HEAR BUDGET ATTACKED FROM BOTH PARTIES
description: President Reagan's proposed budget for the next fiscal year was assailed by both Republicans and Democrats on the House Appropriations Committee today as the Administration's top economic officials began formally presenting the budget to Congress.

title: More Bus Runs to Use Lifts for Wheelchairs
description: The New York City Transit Authority said yesterday that it would expand the use of buses equipped with wheelchair lifts for the handicapped to 20 more routes by the end of February.

title: Scali, McCabe For Mrs. Paul
description: Scali, McCabe, Sloves, the agency that is still trying to get Perdue chicken into every stomach by getting the name Frank Perdue onevery tongue, will next be bending its effort s in behalf of the frozen fish from the kitchen of Mrs. Paul.

title: PEERLESS CHAIN CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
POPE'S PEACE MESSAGE WILL BE READ TONIGHT
description: uf813Pope John Paul II's Message of Peace will be read during the World Day of Peace observance, sponsored by the Permanent Observer Mission of the Holy See to the Uni ted Nations , at St. Patrick's Cathedral tonight at 7:30 o'clock.

title: NATIONAL GUARD IS CLEARED TO AID IN TRANSPORTING OF SURPLUS CHEESE
description: The National Guard has been authorized by the Defense Department to assist in the transportation of Federal surplus cheese for some of New York City's needy.

title: SAHARA ACCORD ELUDES AFRICANS
description: African leaders apparently failed tonight to find ways to resolve the conflict in Western Sahara, where a guerrilla organization is fighting to gain control of the territory from Morocco.

title: ASSOCIATED COCA-COLA BOTTLING CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings reflect a 100% stock dividend in January 1982

title: SOVIET OUTLINES PLAN FOR MISSILE CUTS IN EUROPE
description: The Soviet Union made public today the outline of a missile reduction plan in Europe and urged the United States to accept it in order to break a ''logjam'' that it said was developing in the two-month-old missile talks in Geneva.

title: ANDERSON PROPOSING A COMPROMISE PLAN ON COST OF MEDICAID
description: The Senate majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, today opened the way for a compromise that could have the state take over part of the local costs of Medicaid for at least one year.

title: EARNINGS TURNABOUT AT TEXTRON
description: Textron Inc. reported an earnings turnabout yesterday with net income in the fourth quarter of $32 million, or 86 cents a share, in contrast to a loss of $31.4 million, in the fourth quarter of 1980. Sales slipped 5.4 percent, to $815.5 million, from $862.4 million.

title: Advertising; Ted Bates Acquires Esty
description: largest agency, has acquired the William Esty Company, with which it shares nine clients. It brings Bates billings to more than $2.4 billion. Both are private companies and are not disclosing the details of the purchase.

title: VETERAN IS DISPUTED ON ATOM TEST DATES IN COVER-UP CHARGE
description: David Miller, a spokesman for the United States Department of Energy in Las Vegas, said today that atomic explosions did not occur on the dates given by an former Army medic who said he helped cover up reports of high-level radiation contamination among servicemen involved in the tests.

title: Ever Faster
description: A follow-up: A day after he broke a speed record from downtown London to downtown New York, David Springbett, aided by two Augusta 109 jet helicopters and a British Airways Concorde, established a record for the return trip yesterday. Mr. Springbett, a London insurance executive, made it in 3 hours 40 minutes 40 seconds.

title: VELCRO INDUSTRIES LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Dow Declines 2.86, to 830.57
description: Stock prices continued to slip yesterday on the heels of Monday's sharp drop. Still hanging over the market was investor concern about interest rates and the Reagan Administration's projected record budget deficit.

title: A FEDERALISM SHORN OF POLITICAL RISK
description: To the Editor:

title: THE POP LIFE
description: THERE is no such thing as ''rock opera.'' Accuse anyone of having composed one, and you will get a firm denial, followed by a comment to the effect that the very idea of a rock opera is too pretentious for words.

title: WALES ALL-STARS TRIUMPH ON 2 GOALS BY BOSSY, 4-2
description: Mike Bossy of the Islanders scored two successive goals tonight to lead the Wales Conference to a 4-2 triumph over the Campbell Conference in the National Hockey League's 34th All-Star Game.

title: PATHMARK OPERATOR BUYS PANTRY PRIDE
description: The Supermarkets General Corporation, which operates Pathmark supermarkets and other stores, said yesterday that it had agreed to acquire Pantry Pride Inc. through an exchange of stock valued at about $130 million. Pantry Pride operates supermarkets in Florida and several other Southern states.

title: ROBERTSON, H H, CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After $1.4 million charge for the quarter relating to employee terminations incurred in England and Brazil and $690,000 loss from a change in accounting for foreign currency translation for the quarter and $3 million gain from the changein accounting for foreign currency; C-Includes $1.9 million gain from the recovery of prior years' deferred taxes in England

title: METROPOLITAN DIARY
description: IT'S all very well to participate in the quaint though traditional excesses of Valenti ne's Day, but is Valentine 's Day really good for you? Metropolitan Diary consul ted Dr. Joseph J. Neuschatz, M.D., its medical authority. Dr. Neuschatz, an anesthesiologist from Port Jefferson, L.I., has held forth in this space about doctor s' handwriting and other crucial matters. So we posed the fol lowing question: ''Dear Dr. Neuschatz: Can Valentine's Day be haz ardous to your health?''

title: Canadian Pacific Unit Names Chief Executive
description: Robert W. Campbell, 59, will become chief executive officer of Canadian Pacific Enterprises Ltd., one of Canada's major industrial and natural resource companies, on April 29, the company announced yesterday. Mr. Campbell has been chairman and chief executive officer of PanCanadian Petroleum Ltd., a Canadian Pacific subsidiary, since 1971.

title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE POLISH DEBT
description: To the Editor:

title: West German Ship Saves Refugees From Pirates
description: The crew of a West German rescue ship saved 99 Vietnamese ''boat people'' from the hands of pirates after a sea chase in the Gulf of Thailand, a refugee aid organization reported today. A spokesman for the privately sponsored Com mittee of Emergency Doctors said a boat with 124 refugees on boar d left Vietnam last Thursday, but it was boarded by pirates who s hot to death 14 of the boat people.

title: Reagan Opens Energy Unit
description: President Reagan issued an executive order today declaring the United States Synthetic Fuels Corporation in business, making it possible for the agency to begin supervising two large oil shale projects in Colorado.

title: Real Estate; Trinity C hurch as L andlord
description: MANHATTAN'S financial district is full of people who believe real estate investments are a good protection against inflation, and so it should come as no surprise when the historic Episcopal church that looks down on Wall Street fr om Trinity Place joins in the chorus.

title: HOW FRESH IS THE PRODUCE IN NEW YORK' MARKETS?
description: NO other city in the United States and possibly in the world offers its food shoppers easy access to such a wide variety of fruits and vegetables as does New York. On virtually every other street corner, it seems, shops display glistening rows of vegetables and shiny mounds of fruit all day long seven days a week. Because a lot of the produce looks wonderful, we tend to assume it is fresh. Is it really?

title: Foster Signing Set Today
description: The Mets announced last night that they would hold a news conference at 2 P.M. at Shea Stadium today for the formal signing of George Foster, the former Cincinnati Reds' slugger, who will be on hand.

title: Block Assails Embargo Talk
description: Agriculture Secretary John R. Block said today that rumors and speculation about the possibility of the Administration's imposing a trade embargo on the Soviet Union were hurting farmers.

title: The Police Blotter
description: Two women were found dead yesterday in their home at 91 Targee Street in Grymes Hill, S.I., after a fire that broke out shortly after 2 P.M. They were identified as Mary Parnell, 79 years old, and her daughter, Marie, 60. ... Two armed men held up a the Sawa Gift Shop at 745 Manhattan Avenue in the Greenpoint section of Brooklyn at about 1 P.M. and escaped with $25,000 in cash and jewelry. ... Three armed men forced a van from the Chase Manhattan Bank off Bruckner Boulevard in the East Bronx at 11:40 A.M. and stole voided food stamps and canceled checks that would have been worth $100,000 if not already cashed, the police said. The men, one carrying a submachine gun, ordered the bank couriers from the van and then stole three bags containing the worthless food stamps and canceled checks.

title: Muskie Recovering
description: In Bethesda Naval Hospital outside Washington yesterday, Edmund S. Muskie, the former Secretary of State and United States Senator from Maine, was reported making a good recovery from an eight-hour back operation.

title: AIRBORNE FREIGHT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
UNITED STATES TOBACCO CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $365,000 for the qr and $914,000 for the yr...C-After $1,003,000 loss from discontinued operations and $1,647,000 loss on disposal of business

title: SKIPPER'S FISH & CHIPS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 27
British Car Output
